reviewText:
Yes, it's great.....but WHO has a VHS machine anymore?
They need to get this out on DVD before all the people who REMEMBER the things that aren't here anymore .....CROAK!
very nostalgic and well written book, love the photos

I bought this to watch with my aged inlaws (93 and 90).  They loved it!  I want to get more of this type of video.  They are great.  It was in great shape and brought backk many fun memories.  Thank you.
Great way of seeing all the various locations and architecture of Los Angeles during the many years of the city's developmental evolution, historians of days gone-by would love.

As an ex-Angelena this had a very strong effect on me.  Some of it was before I could remember, but it was nice to see what I only saw the remnants of as a child before I left LA.  I think there's a second program but I don't know where to look for it.  I miss Ralph Story's dry narration -- he used to have a weekly show about old LA.
Interesting.  Not what I'd call fascinating, but interesting.  I enjoyed watching it.  Not sure whether or not I'm interested in viewing it again.
